page.title: 19Local History
page.content: Ugbrooke House is situated about half a mile outside the small market town of Chudleigh.Ugbrooke got its name from Wogbroga or twisted stream.The earliest record of a settlement on the site was the Dane settlement of Dumnunnii in 879.The original house and church were built about 1200 and redesigned by Robert Adam.The Clifford family live in the house and the rooms are in constant use.Ugbrooke contains fine furniture and paintings,beautiful embroideries,uniforms an costumes.Another attraction will be the Cardinals bedroom with four poster bed.The chapel is used for public worship,it is a R.C. chapel built & designed by Robert Adam.The altar floor and pillars are made of Devon,Irish & Italian marble.There is a secret priest hiding hole behind a wall from which leads a passage to the
